title: How to Make Blackberry Pancakes

steps.headline: Mix the sifted flour with the sugar, baking powder and salt.
Crack the eggs into a separate mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add the milk and oil as well, then the dry ingredients. Stir to combine. The batter is done when there are no lumps.

steps.headline: Tip the blackberries into the batter.
steps.description: Do this gently, to avoid breaking them up; just stir in briefly.

steps.headline: Preheat the frying pan or skillet.
steps.description: Add your preference of oil or butter for cooking the pancakes in.

steps.headline: Cook on a medium to medium-high heat.
steps.description: When you can see bubbles popping on the surface and the sides of the pancake are holding together, flip it over and cook the other side until the same signs appear.

steps.headline: Remove from the pan.
steps.description: Serve immediately, with your topping of choice.

steps.headline: Crack the egg.
steps.description: Separate the yolk from the white. Beat the egg white until it's stiff. Then set aside.

steps.headline: Melt the butter.
steps.description: Set aside to cool just a little.

steps.headline: Mix the flour, sugar, egg yolk and milk in a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add the blackberries when the batter is formed, doing so gently to avoid breaking them up too much.

steps.headline: Stir in the melted butter and egg white.
steps.description: Stir through quickly.

steps.headline: Cook in the pan to which you've added a little butter.
steps.description: Cook over medium heat. Alternatively, use a non-stick pan and cook without any added fat.

steps.headline: Cook until the pancakes are fluffy and omelet-like.
steps.description: When browned, remove from the heat.

steps.headline: Serve hot.
steps.description: Add a dollop of whipped cream or ice cream and a few uncooked blackberries. Or, pour over a favorite syrup (and still add the uncooked blackberries).

steps.headline: Finished.
Make the blackberry sauce first.
steps.description: Place the blackberries and sugar into a heavy-based medium saucepan. Bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook until the sauce thickens, stirring frequently. After about 5 minutes, remove the sauce from the stove. Allow to cool slightly. When cooled, transfer to a piping bag in readiness for use. Set aside for now.

steps.headline: Make the pancakes next.
steps.description: Place the flour, sugar and baking powder into a flour sifter and sift into a mixing bowl. Stir to combine.

steps.headline: Place the milk, egg, vanilla extract and melted butter into a separate bowl.
steps.description: Stir to combine.

steps.headline: Add the liquid mixture to the dry mixture.
steps.description: Whisk together to combine slightly. Expect lumps.

steps.headline: Prepare the griddle.
steps.description: If the griddle needs greasing, do so; otherwise, it's ready for heating. Heat the griddle to 350ºF/180ºC.

steps.headline: Transfer the buttermilk batter to the heated griddle, forming small pancakes.
Pipe the blackberry sauce onto each pancake.
steps.description: Do so in a spiral formation, from the outside to the center of each pancake.

steps.headline: Cook.
steps.description: When you can see bubbles popping on the surface and the sides of the pancake are holding together, flip it over and cook the other side until the same signs appear.

steps.headline: Remove from the griddle when cooked.
steps.description: Serve immediately with toppings of your choice.
